title: Avocado Caesar Green Beans
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Avocado Caesar Green Beans a try. One serving contains 543 calories, 17g of protein, and 16g of fat. For $1.57 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 2. A mixture of butter, white wine, pasta, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. 209 people have tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by fullbellysisters.blogspot.com. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 83%, which is tremendous.
instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
3. Add the white wine and cook for another 1-2 minutes until slightly reduced.
4. Add the thawed cauliflower florets and cook until they are heated through, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the cooked pasta, extra virgin olive oil, grated cheese, and scallions to the skillet. Toss to combine.
6. Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes to taste.
7. Serve immediately, garnished with additional cheese and breadcrumbs if desired.

title: Double Chocolate Cookies
summary: Crunchy Brussels Sprouts Salad might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe makes 4 servings with 150 calories, 4g of protein, and 8g of fat each. For $1.12 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 101 people have made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 25 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 92%. This score is tremendous. Try similar recipes like Crunchy Brussels Sprouts Salad, Crunchy Brussels Sprouts Salad, and Crunchy Brussels Sprouts Salad.
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter and sugars together until light and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the vanilla extract and mix until combined.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Fold in the chocolate chips.
6. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set and the tops are slightly cracked.
8. Remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Big Yummy Italian Salad
summary: Homemade Chicken Pot Pie might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 6 and costs $2.25 per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 34g of protein, 25g of fat, and a total of 550 calories. It is a rather inexpensive recipe for fans of American food. 509 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. If you have peas, carrots, chicken breast, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour. It is brought to you by Taste of Home. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 85%. This score is excellent.
instructions:
1. In a large salad bowl, combine the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and olives.
2. In a small bowl or jar, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat all the ingredients.
4. Add the crumbled feta cheese and toss again lightly.
5. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and a sprinkle of additional salt and pepper if desired.
6. Serve immediately as a refreshing and flavorful side dish or main course.

title: Marry Me Chicken
summary: Butternut Squash Soup requires about 50 minutes from start to finish. This recipe makes 4 servings with 200 calories, 4g of protein, and 5g of fat each. For $1.34 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as a soup. 320 people have tried and liked this recipe. Head to the store and pick up butternut squash, vegetable broth, garlic, and a few other things to make it today. It is brought to you by AllRecipes. Overall, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 95%. This score is excellent. Try similar recipes like Butternut Squash Soup, Butternut Squash Soup, and Butternut Squash Soup.
instructions:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then add to skillet. Cook until golden brown on each side, about 5-7 minutes per side. Remove chicken and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
4. Stir in sun-dried tomatoes and chicken broth. Bring to a simmer.
5. Return chicken to skillet and spoon sauce over chicken. Simmer until chicken is cooked through and sauce has thickened, about 10 minutes.
6. Sprinkle with fresh basil and serve hot, garnished with grated cheese if desired.

title: Incredible Gochujang Sauce
summary: Easy Avocado Toast is a super simple breakfast recipe that can be made in just 10 minutes. This recipe serves 2 and costs about $1.50 per serving. One serving contains 250 calories, 6g of protein, and 15g of fat. 150 people have made this recipe and would make it again. If you have avocado, bread, lemon juice, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is brought to you by Minimalist Baker. Overall, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 90%. This score is outstanding. Try similar recipes like Easy Avocado Toast, Easy Avocado Toast, and Easy Avocado Toast.
instructions:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together gochujang paste, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, honey, and minced garlic until well combined.
2. Gradually whisk in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency is reached.
3. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed, adding more honey for sweetness or more gochujang for spice.
4. Use immediately as a dipping sauce, marinade, or drizzle over cooked dishes.
5. Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.

title: Two Huge Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs about $1.75 per serving. One serving contains 300 calories, 28g of protein, and 12g of fat. This recipe is liked by 210 people. Head to the store and pick up chicken breast, basil leaves, soy sauce, and a few other ingredients to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 30 minutes. It is brought to you by Delish. Overall, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 88%. This score is great. Try similar recipes like Spicy Thai Basil Chicken, Spicy Thai Basil Chicken, and Spicy Thai Basil Chicken.
instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
5. Fold in the chocolate chips until evenly distributed throughout the dough.
6. Divide the dough into two equal portions and shape each into a large cookie, placing them on the prepared baking sheet.
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-18 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the centers are set.
8. Remove from the oven and allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Enjoy your deliciously large chocolate chip cookies!

title: Stuffed Chicken with Rice
summary: Delicious stuffed chicken breasts with a savory rice filling. One serving contains 350 calories, 35g of protein, and 12g of fat. This recipe serves 4. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 50 minutes.
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cook the rice according to package instructions and set aside.
3. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onions, garlic, and bell peppers until softened.
4. Mix cooked rice with sautéed vegetables. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
5. Slice chicken breasts horizontally to create a pocket. Stuff each chicken breast with the rice mixture and secure with toothpicks.
6. Place stuffed chicken breasts in a baking dish. Pour chicken broth over the chicken.
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
8. Remove toothpicks before serving. Enjoy your stuffed chicken with rice!

title: Stuffed Peppers
summary: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with a savory filling. One serving contains 300 calories, 25g of protein, and 14g of fat. This recipe serves 4. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 55 minutes.
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove seeds and membranes. Place the peppers in a baking dish.
3. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onions and garlic until softened.
4. Add ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned. Season with salt and black pepper.
5. Stir in cooked rice and tomato sauce. Cook for 5 minutes, allowing flavors to meld.
6. Spoon the beef and rice mixture evenly into the bell peppers. Top with shredded cheese.
7. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 30-35 minutes, until peppers are tender.
8. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving. Enjoy your stuffed peppers!

title: Creamy Chicken Lasagna
summary: Rich and creamy lasagna made with tender chicken and a cheesy sauce. One serving contains 450 calories, 30g of protein, and 22g of fat. This recipe serves 8. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 70 minutes.
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
3. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onions and garlic until softened.
4. Add shredded chicken and spinach to the skillet. Cook until spinach is wilted. Remove from heat.
5. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour to create a roux. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
6. Gradually whisk in milk, stirring constantly until sauce thickens. Season with salt and black pepper.
7. Remove sauce from heat. Stir in ricotta cheese until well combined.
8. In a large baking dish, layer lasagna noodles, chicken mixture, mozzarella cheese, and sauce. Repeat layers.
9. Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
10. Remove foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until cheese is bubbly and golden.
11. Let lasagna cool for 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy your creamy chicken lasagna!

extendedIngredients.name: chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.original: 2 large chicken breasts, cooked and shredded
